pullRequest.body:
We use the Maximum modulus principle to show that modular forms of non-positive weights are bounded by its value of some element of the upper half plane imaginary part at least 1/2.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

### PR summary [1a1400e3e8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18192/commits/1a1400e3e8b9dcccf4a8af07816051ed0c818d39)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.LevelOne`|1577|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Complex.zpow_eq_one`
`+ SlashInvariantForm.exists_norm_le`
`+ SlashInvariantForm.wt_const_eq_zero`
`+ coe_one`
`+ denom_S`
`+ denom_one`
`+ exists_translate`
`+ exists_translate'`
`+ slash_action_eqn''`
`+ three_le_four_mul_im_sq_of_mem_fd`
`- SlashInvariantFormClass.coe_coe`
`- mul_slash_subgroup`
`- subgroupAction`
`- subgroup_slash`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Following some discussion with @CBirkbeck, I've pushed some changes to this branch which avoid making subgroups of SL2Z into subtypes, which gets rid of some unnecessary coercions and API lemmas.

```suggestion
/-- For every ` : ` there is some matrix in `SL(2, )` that sends it to an element whose
```
and I would either change the second line to "and whose denominator has norm at most 1", or say what \gamma is.
(This could also go in one line, in my opinion.)

```suggestion
/-- The map from `SL(2, )` to `(1)`. Its preferable to work with this, since levels of modular
```
what is the alternative to "working with this"? As an outside reader, this comment is not completely clear to me.

How about this?
```suggestion
/-- Every `SlashInvariantForm` `f` satisfies ` f (  z) = (denom  z) ^ k * f z`. -/

This worries me a bit since `(1)` is by definition a subgroup of `SL(2, )`, so there will already be a `Coe` instance going the other way. Do we need it going this way as well? It sounds like it might cause confusion to have Coe instances in both directions at once.
These local notations are getting reused in many places, they should be promoted to `scoped notation` which can be re-opened when needed.

I scoped them in CongruenceSubgroup namespace, ~~but I wanted to try and do it for SlashInvariantForms, but I couldn't seem to do it for SL since the notation was also local (and changing all the notation in the top half of the file seemed to annoying to do). Is there a way to forget the notation halfway down a file?~~

I think it would considerably simplify matters to declare this as `( : SL2Z) (h :  \in )`. This avoids making `` into a subtype, and so we never have to worry about coercions from this subtype to other things.
It turns out that this notation already exists, scoped in the `MatrixGroups` namespace.

pullRequest.title: feat: bounds for modular forms of non-positive weights
